channel.title: Fake shitty authentication systems (like Nexus)
channel.description:
This is not comprehensive or new.
[b]Requirements[/b]
[ul][li]Network sniffer, such as Wireshark.[/li] [li]A web-server, such as Apache.[/li][/ul]
[b]Steps[/b]
[ul][li]Get the program you want to by-pass. This cannot magically download the program that contains the authentication system you want to by-pass.[/li] [li]Start up Wireshark, and turn on the sniffer.[/li] [li]Start up the program you want to by-pass, and try to auth (obviously fail)[/li] [li]Stop sniffing, turn the Wireshark filter to HTTP. Analyze the logs. Find the locations on the web it checks for authentication.[/li] [li]Replicate the directory structure on your web-server.[/li] [li]Make your fake authentication on your web-server return the 'passed' authentication method for the bot. If you don't know this, or have any idea to it, have someone with an authentication authenticate himself and give you the 'passed' authentication message. There is also a chance that it just checks to make sure that you [b]didn't[/b] get the 'rejected' authentication message.[/li] [li]Make your hosts file redirect to your web-server.. If the original auth. URL was an IP then you have to use your router or find alternate methods (GOOGLE).[/li][/ul]
I by-passed Nexus/Ibot authentication system within five-minute with no help from anyone who already have an auth.. Obviously developers of various application need to return something unique to each user.. but nothing like generic MD5sum because they can be reverse engineer.. etc.

item.title: Fake shitty authentication systems (like Nexus)
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Original Daniel:

To do this, don’t you need nexus pro to begin with? I’m pretty sure you can’t just download lite, (why the hell does ruler spell it like that anyway?) crack it, and it turns into pro.

Heres why… I hope your not thinking he meant “light”?

Read full topic

item.title: Fake shitty authentication systems (like Nexus)
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

xxlegitxx:

Well wireshark was released only lately, so it’s gotta be new.

1.0 was released but its been out for 10 years…

Read full topic

item.title: Fake shitty authentication systems (like Nexus)
item.dc:creator: @zzzzzzz zzzzzzz
item.description:
@zzzzzzz wrote:

# Get the program you want to by-pass. This cannot magically download the program that contains the authentication system you want to by-pass.

Nexus/Ibot Pro is laying around his web directory (albeit and old version http://www.rscheata.net/pro/nexus18104pro.jar) that you can stick it your lite installation. This isn’t specifically about Nexus/Ibot… Oh well, I’m out.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @zzzzzzz zzzzzzz
item.description:
@zzzzzzz wrote:

xxlegitxx:

Well wireshark was released only lately, so it’s gotta be new.

Wireshark used to be name Ethereal. And you can do this with practically any network sniffer.

item.title: Fake shitty authentication systems (like Nexus)
item.dc:creator: @zzzzzzz zzzzzzz
item.description:
@zzzzzzz wrote:

This is not comprehensive or new.

Requirements

[ul][li]Network sniffer, such as Wireshark.[/li]
[li]A web-server, such as Apache.[/li][/ul]

Steps

[ul][li]Get the program you want to by-pass. This cannot magically download the program that contains the authentication system you want to by-pass.[/li]
[li]Start up Wireshark, and turn on the sniffer.[/li]
[li]Start up the program you want to by-pass, and try to auth (obviously fail)[/li]
[li]Stop sniffing, turn the Wireshark filter to HTTP. Analyze the logs. Find the locations on the web it checks for authentication.[/li]
[li]Replicate the directory structure on your web-server.[/li]
[li]Make your fake authentication on your web-server return the ‘passed’ authentication method for the bot. If you don’t know this, or have any idea to it, have someone with an authentication authenticate himself and give you the ‘passed’ authentication message. There is also a chance that it just checks to make sure that you didn’t get the ‘rejected’ authentication message.[/li]
[li]Make your hosts file redirect to your web-server… If the original auth. URL was an IP then you have to use your router or find alternate methods (GOOGLE).[/li][/ul]

I by-passed Nexus/Ibot authentication system within five-minute with no help from anyone who already have an auth… Obviously developers of various application need to return something unique to each user… but nothing like generic MD5sum because they can be reverse engineer… etc.

Read full topic
